Chunk Text: A fire broke out late Monday night at the Dryden Textiles facility on the east end of the industrial district. Witnesses reported seeing smoke as early as 11:40 p.m., with flames visible from the adjacent highway by midnight. Fire crews from three neighboring towns responded. They contained the blaze after five hours.
Fact: A fire broke out late Monday night at the Dryden Textiles facility.
Contradictions:
A fire broke out early Tuesday morning at the Dryden Textiles facility.
A fire broke out late Monday night at the Dryden Electronics facility.
A fire broke out late Sunday night at the Dryden Textiles facility.

Chunk Text: No fatalities were reported, but two workers remain hospitalized with smoke inhalation. Over 120 employees arrived Tuesday morning to find the building sealed off. Many had not yet been informed about the fire and waited behind barricades until police cleared the area. Management issued a brief statement through local media, confirming that operations would be suspended indefinitely.

Several fatalities were reported.

Chunk Text: The company did not respond to requests for further comment. Dryden Textiles, a manufacturer of synthetic fabric for commercial use, has operated in the area since 1972. The facility has been cited twice in the past five years for safety violations, including an unresolved citation related to faulty electrical systems. City inspectors began preliminary assessments early Tuesday.
